Comment: >Johnson says the $1.5 trillion deficit reduction number that the Speaker is aiming for is “a joke.”  “$1.5 trillion over 10 years? That’s $150 billion a year. That takes it from $7.3 trillion to, at most, $7.1 trillion. What I’m saying, at most, we should be looking at $6.5 trillion,” the Wisconsin senator said at the WisPolitics D.C. Breakfast in March.        Crazy idea, I know, but how about decreasing spending on the military, not increasing it? Just a thought.
